Models

Card Classes

File Description

File to create the base information card class.

class card_classes.CardType(Enum)

Enum specifying whether the card is a text card or data card.

class card_classes.CardQuantityType(Enum)

Enum specifying whether the quantity the card talks about is “most” or “least”. Useful to create custom card descriptions easily.

class card_classes.Card

Base card class for the GUI information card elements.

classmethod display_number(self) → str

Property that modifies the cards serial number to have a leading zero if the number is a single digit to make it more presentable in a larger font.

Returns:

Display number of the card, modified with the required leading zeroes.

Return type:

str

card_classes.TextCard(Card):

Subclass of the Card class that only contains textual information.

classmethod card_classes.TextCard.__post_init__(self)

Automatically set the type of the card to a text card after the class is initialised.

static card_classes.TextCard.sale_card(serial_number: int, medicine: Medicine | None, sale_type: CardQuantityType) → TextCard

Create a new sale related text card using a fixed template to avoid having to write the card information every time.

Parameters:

  • serial_number (int) – Serial number of the card.

  • medicine (Medicine | None) – Medicine which the card is talking about, or None.

  • sale_type (CardQuantityType) – Whether the sale of the medicine was the most or the least out of all.

Returns:

Customised text card about the medicine sale if the medicine is given else, a default blank card.

Return type:

TextCard

static card_classes.TextCard.stock_card(serial_number: int, medicine: Medicine, stock_type: CardQuantityType) → TextCard

Create a new stock related text card using a fixed template to avoid having to write the card information every time.

Parameters:

  • serial_number (int) – Serial number of the card.

  • medicine (Medicine | None) – Medicine which the card is talking about.

  • stock_type (CardQuantityType) – Whether the sale of the medicine was the most or the least out of all.

Returns:

Customised text card about the medicine stock.

Return type:

TextCard

class card_classes.DataCard(Card)

Subclass of the Card class that contains textual and graphical information. The graph is the pie chart.

classmethod __post_init__(self)

Automatically set the type of the card to a data card after the class is initialised.

Cards

File Description

File to create and manage all of the information cards for the dashboard and manage all its surrounding data.

cards._generate_sale_card() → tuple[TextCard, TextCard]

Private function to generate two sale quantity text cards that show the most and least sold medicines during the current week.

Returns:

Cards with most and least sold medicine during the current week.

Return type:

tuple[TextCard, TextCard]

cards._generate_stock_card() → tuple[TextCard, TextCard]

Private function to generate two current stock text cards that show the most and least stocked medicines.

Returns:

Cards with the most and last stocked medicines.

Return type:

tuple[TextCard, TextCard]

cards._generate_sales_comparison() → DataCard

Private function to generate a sales comparison data card that compares the number of units sold week over week from the current week to the previous week.

Returns:

Card with the sales comparison of the current and previous week.

Return type:

DataCard

cards.generate_all_text_cards() → list[TextCard]

Generate all of the text cards for the dashboard view.

Returns:

All of the text cards.

Return type:

list[TextCard]

cards.generate_all_data_cards() → list[DataCard]

Generate all of the data cards for the dashboard view.

Returns:

All of the data cards.

Return type:

list[DataCard]

Employee

File Description

Main employee file. Generate all the database models for the employees in the MySQL database.

class employee.Employee

Employee dataclass representing a medicine store employee.

classmethod __post_init__(self)

Generate a random unique employee ID and assign the gender to be the first letter, capitalised after the class is initialised.

classmethod full_name(self) → str

Property that sets the full name of the employee as a formatted string to make it more readable when it is very long, for instance.

Returns:

Full name of the employee, truncated to the first 17 characters.

Return type:

str

classmethod add_to_database(self)

Add the employee data to the database using a MySQL command.

static get_all() → list[Employee]

Get all the employees from the database using a MySQL query.

Returns:

List of all the employees in the database.

Return type:

list[Employee]

static get_all_ids() → list[int]

Get all the employee IDs from the database using a MySQL query.

Returns:

List of all the employee IDs in the database.

Return type:

list[int]

static get_by_id(id_: int) → Employee | None

Retrieve a specific employee from the database using a MySQL query with the employee’s ID as primary key.

Parameters:

id (int) – Employee ID for the specific employee, primary key.

Returns:

Employee data if an employee with the given ID exists in the database else None.

Return type:

Employee | None

static get_by_email_address(email_address: str) → Employee | None

Retrieve a specific employee from the database using a MySQL query with the employee’s email address which should be unique, although, it is not the primary key. Used when authenticating the employee during login.

Parameters:

email_address (str) – Email address of the specific employee.

Returns:

Employee data if an employee with the given email address exists in the database else None.

Return type:

Employee | None

static generate_random_id() → int

Generate a new unique random ID for a new employee.

Returns:

New random, unique employee ID.

Return type:

int

static match_password(email_address: str, password: str) → bool

Used during login to confirm the employee’s email address and password against the database records.

Parameters:

  • email_address (str) – Email address entered on the login page.

  • password (str) – Password entered on the login page.

Returns:

True if the email address and password match those on the database else False.

Return type:

bool

Medicine

File Description

Main medicine file. Generate all the database models for the medicines in the MySQL database.

class medicine.Medicine

Medicine dataclass for the inventory. Dates are stored as strings to be compatible with the MySQL date datatype.

classmethod __post_init__(self)

Assign a new unique random ID for the medicine if not provided in the constructor.

classmethod _salts_str(self) → str

Convert the list of salts (str) into a single string with comma separated values which is easier to load into MySQL.

Returns:

All the medicine salts in one comma-separated string.

Return type:

str

classmethod add_to_database(self)

Add the medicine data to the database using a MySQL command.

static update_in_database(medicine_id: int, field_name: str, new_value: Any)

Update a particular piece of medicine data in the database with updated data using a MySQL command.

static get_all() → list[Medicine]

Get all the medicines from the database using a MySQL query.

Returns:

List of all the medicines in the database.

Return type:

list[Medicine]

static get_as_json() → str

Get all the medicines from the database using a MySQL query and parse their id, name, manufacturer and stock as JSON. Useful to transfer medicine data from Python to JavaScript.

Returns:

Medicine data as JSON.

Return type:

str

static get_all_ids() → list[int]

Get all the medicine IDs from the database using a MySQL query.

Returns:

List of all the medicine IDs in the database.

Return type:

list[int]

static get_by_id(id_: int) → Medicine | None

Retrieve a specific medicine from the database using a MySQL query with the medicine’s ID as primary key.

Parameters:

id (int) – Medicine ID for the specific medicine, primary key.

Returns:

Medicine data if a medicine with the given ID exists in the database else None.

Return type:

Medicine | None

static get_quantities_sorted(reverse: bool = False) → list[Medicine]

Retrieve all of the medicines from the database using a MySQL query and sort them on the basis of their quantities.

Parameters:

reverse (bool) – Reverse the order of the sorting, defaults to False.

Returns:

List of all medicines sorted by their quantities.

Return type:

list[Medicine]

static get_stock_sorted(reverse: bool = False) → list[Medicine]

Retrieve all of the medicines from the database using a MySQL query and sort them on the basis of their stocks.

Parameters:

reverse (bool) – Reverse the order of the sorting, defaults to False.

Returns:

List of all medicines sorted by their stocks.

Return type:

list[Medicine]

static generate_random_id() → int

Generate a new unique random ID for a new medicine.

Returns:

New random, unique medicine ID.

Return type:

int

File Description

Main sales file. Generate all the database models for the sales in the MySQL database.

class sale.Sale

Sale dataclass for the inventory. Dates are stored as strings to be compatible with the MySQL date datatype.

classmethod __post_init__(self)

Assign a new unique random ID for the medicine if not provided in the constructor.

classmethod add_to_database(self)

Return type:

static get_all_this_week() → list[Sale]

Retrieve all the sales made in the current week from the database using a MySQL query.

List of all sales made in the current week.

Return type:

list[Sale]

static get_all_last_week() → list[Sale]

Return type:

list[Sale]

static get_week_over_week() → int

Get the number of sales made this week over the number of sales made last week.

Returns:

Number of sales week-over-week.

int
